tool.name: Normalize By Median
tool.description: Filters a fastq/fasta file using digital normalization via median k-mer abundances.
tool.command: normalize-by-median.py $paired_switch #if $parameters.type == "simple" --ksize=20 --n_hashes=4 --hashsize=$parameters.hashsize --cutoff=20 #else --ksize=$parameters.ksize --n_hashes=$parameters.n_hashes --hashsize=$parameters.hashsize_specific --cutoff=$parameters.cutoff #end if #if $save_hashtable --savehash=$hash #end if #if $hashtable_to_load --loadhash=$hashtable_to_load #end if --out=$output #for input in $inputs $input #end for

param.name: inputs
param.label: FAST[AQ] file(s)
param.help: Put in order of precedence such as longest reads first.

param.name: paired_switch
param.label: Are the inputs interleaved paired ends?
param.help: If so, then selecting this option will process the paired ends together.

param.name: hashtable_to_load
param.label: an optional khmer hashtable to load
param.help: The inputs file(s) will be processed using the kmer counts in the specified hashtable file as a starting point.

param.name: save_hashtable
param.label: Save the kmer counts hashtable(s) in a file

param.name: type
param.label: Advanced Parameters
param.help: ksize, n_hashess, a specific hashsize, cutoff

param.name: hashsize
param.label: Sample Type
param.option: Small Animal Genome or Low-Diversity Metagenome

param.name: n_hashes
param.label: n_hashes
param.help: number of hash tables to use

param.name: hashsize_specifc
param.label: hashsize
param.help: lower bound on the hashsize to use
